importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident when Houthi rebels detained 20 UN employees and raided a UN facility in Sanaa.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred on the same day as the previous raid in Sanaa, indicating a pattern of escalating attacks on UN facilities.

keyTakeAways: Iranian-backed Houthi rebels detained 20 United Nations employees in Sanaa, Yemen, on October 19, 2025.
The detained staff include five Yemenis and 15 international staff from organizations such as the World Food Program, UNICEF, and the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs.
The rebels confiscated all communication equipment, including phones, servers, and computers, from the Sanaa facility.
The UN has previously suspended operations in Saada province after detaining eight staff in January 2025 and relocated its top humanitarian coordinator from Sanaa to Aden.
The Houthis have repeatedly accused UN staff and foreign workers of being spies, claims the UN has firmly denied.
This incident is part of a long-running crackdown by Houthi rebels against international humanitarian operations in Yemen.
The UN is actively contacting Houthi leaders and other parties to resolve the crisis and restore control over its facilities in Sanaa.

summaryOfNewsArticle: On October 19, 2025, Iranian-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen detained 20 United Nations employees, including five Yemenis and 15 international staff from agencies such as the World Food Program, UNICEF, and OCHA, at a facility in Sanaa’s Hada neighborhood. The rebels confiscated all communication equipment, continuing a long-standing pattern of targeting humanitarian operations. The UN has previously suspended operations in Saada province and moved its top coordinator to Aden due to similar attacks. The Houthis have accused UN staff of spying, which the UN has denied. The incident underscores a broader crisis of trust and security affecting international humanitarian efforts in conflict-ridden Yemen, with implications for global stability and access to aid.
title: Yemen’s Houthi rebels detain 20 UN employees and confiscate equipment
